title: Kim Porter report (Fbi - Los Angeles Field Office)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Kim Porter report (Fbi - Los Angeles Field Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The request is directed to the North Hollywood Community Police Station, asking for records related to Kim Porter under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). I request the disclosure of all LAPD and FBI records on Kim Porter, including her autopsy report, police files, and any other relevant documents.

I make this request as a journalist on behalf of the “public interest.” My reason for wanting Kim Porter’s files falls under “article 28 C.F.R. §16.5 (e)(1)(iv)” as she was a public figure. And under “article 28 C.F.R. §16.5 (e)(1)(ii)” I intend to write an article about the untimely death of Kim Porter, focusing on how she died and the controversy surrounding it. Reportedly, she had shared with friends credible threats to her life and was a victim of multiple domestic violence incidents. I understand that her family has suspicions regarding her death, which further adds to the importance of exploring the circumstances surrounding it. This information will be used in preparation for upcoming articles on my personal website. I look forward to your response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cassie Sipe

title: Graceland Bomb/death threats (Memphis Police Department)

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Graceland Bomb/death threats (Memphis Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all files related to the Graceland bomb threats on October 24, 1994, and December 7, 1994, as well as any similar incidents or threats that occurred over the last few decades. The UFCN is 9A ME 47813. 

On the specified dates, a woman made threatening calls to Graceland, demanding to speak with Lisa Marie Presley in an apparent attempt to extort property from her. When she did not receive a response from Mrs. Presley, she escalated her threats to include harm to Mrs. Presley's life.

In a separate incident (UFCN 9A-ME 55293) on June 26, 2001, Graceland received a threatening call indicating that a hit had been placed on Mrs. Presley. Mrs. Presley’s FBI file notes that a SWAT team was dispatched to Graceland for her protection. I respectfully request the release of all files related to these incidents.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Cassie Sipe.

title: hackbloc

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: hackbloc
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Absolutely any and all files and materials regarding or referencing the hacker activist group known as "Hackbloc" which had a web presence at the url "https://www.hackbloc.org" or the authors of the hacker activist magazine "hack this zine" including hackers going by the following aliases: flatline, alxCIAda, pacifico, hexbomber, xor, evoltech, or any others associated that occurred between October 23, 2003 and March 5th, 2012.

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, emails, chat logs, etc.

Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency.

Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials. Please search all relevant indices and databases. An insufficient search would be one that does not check the various locations in which records on or relating to this individuals are stored.

Please provide materials on a rolling basis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cooper Quintin

title: mspy and brainstack records (Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: mspy and brainstack records (Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The requested records are all those, for the period between January 1, 2018 and the date on which this request is processed, describing and relating to the relationship between this agency and Brainstack, LLC and any relationships between any representative of either entity.
Responsive records include, but are not limited to, the following:
• All documents concerning or mentioning Brainstack, LLC and any representative thereof, including all documentation regarding mSpy and any other service or software provided by or created by Brainstack, LLC
CONTRACT AND AGREEMENTS
• All contracts, memorandums of understanding, and any other written agreements between this agency and Brainstack, including all associated amendments, exhibits, and supplemental and supporting documentation.
FINANCIAL MATERIALS
• All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the relationship between the aforementioned entities. Responsive materials include all invoices, bills, receipts, check stubs, or any other records, including those possessed in an electronic format. This also includes any Requests for Proposal and bidding materials provided by Brainstack and any other entities responding to the same Request for Proposal or equivalent procurement request.
MARKETING and PROMOTION MATERIALS
• All promotional, descriptive, and marketing materials in the possession of this agency related to and/or referencing “Brainstack” and/or “mSpy.” This includes all presentations, marketing materials, technical documentation, proposals, or similar records shared with this agency and/or any representative thereof by Brainstack and/or any representative thereof.
GUIDING DOCUMENTATION and POLICIES
• All policies, memorandums of understanding, and other guidance materials generated by this agency and/or any entity operating on its behalf or to its benefit (including, but not limited to, any unions, community groups, other government agencies, or individuals) regarding the acquisition and use of any data or services provided by Brainstack or any subdivision thereof. Responsive materials include, but are not limited to, any data-sharing agreements, terms of use, licensing agreements, and any other guiding materials.
• All user manuals, other guidance materials, help documents, or related materials obtained from Brainstack or the mSpy platform (hosted at www.mspy.com )
DOCUMENTATION OF USE
• Any query logs and other data obtained from the mSpy platform, including any “Signal List” CSV documents generated by the platform. Should query logs exist for any other platform, service, or software created and/or provided by Brainstack, these materials are also responsive to this request.
• Any audits and reports of audits of use of the mSpy platform
COMMUNICATIONS
• All written communications, emails, and attachments between this agency and any representative thereof and Brainstack and any representative thereof. Responsive materials include, but are not limited to, all communications sent to and from any “@brainstack.net” or “@mspy.com” email address, 
All written communications, emails, and attachments containing and/or referencing any of the following terms:
Brainstack
mSpy
NIT 
Network Investigative Technique 
Malware
Spyware 
Remote monitoring tool 
Phone tracker 
keylogger 
We ask that these materials be provided on a rolling basis; as your office collects and reviews records, we would appreciate it if your office would provide those materials to us incrementally.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cooper Quintin

title: Request for Records Related to Detective Michael Hansbro’s Demotion and Alleged Mishandling of Digital Evidence

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: Request for Records Related to Detective Michael Hansbro’s Demotion and Alleged Mishandling of Digital Evidence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

* 1- Demotion Records:
    * Documentation or reports detailing the reasons for Detective Michael Hansbro’s demotion from detective to patrol officer.
    * Any internal memos, emails, or communications regarding the demotion.
    * 2- Disciplinary Actions:
    * Records of any disciplinary actions taken against Detective Michael Hansbro, including reprimands, suspensions, or terminations.
    * Details of any additional training provided to Detective Hansbro following disciplinary actions.
    * 4- Complaints and Investigations:
    * Records of any complaints filed against Detective Michael Hansbro, including both internal and external complaints.
    * Detailed reports from any Internal Affairs investigations involving Detective Michael Hansbro.
    * Logs or summaries of all complaints and the outcomes of any investigations.
    * 4- Performance Evaluations:
    * Copies of Detective Michael Hansbro’s performance evaluations throughout his tenure with the department.
    * 5- Training Records:
    * Records of any training completed by Detective Michael Hansbro, including any remedial training.
    * 6- Incident Reports:
    * Incident reports or case files related to Detective Michael Hansbro’s involvement in specific cases, especially those where misconduct was alleged.
    * 7- Body Camera Footage:
    * Body camera footage from incidents involving Detective Michael Hansbro, if applicable.
    * 8- Supervisor Notes:
    * Notes or reports from the supervisors of Detective Michael Hansbro.
    * 9- Psychological Evaluations:
    * Any psychological evaluations or fitness-for-duty assessments conducted on Detective Michael Hansbro.
    * 10- Early Intervention System (EIS) Records:
    * Early Intervention System (EIS) records related to Detective Michael Hansbro.
    * 11- Field Training Officer (FTO) Reports:
    * Field Training Officer (FTO) reports for Detective Michael Hansbro.
    * 12- Digital Evidence Mishandling:
    * Records of any accusations or investigations involving Detective Michael Hansbro mishandling digital evidence.
    * Documentation of any instances where Detective Michael Hansbro was unable to produce evidence that he had alleged to possess.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jay Hunt

Dear Custodian of Records,

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act (O.C.G.A. § 50-18-70 et seq.), I am requesting copies of any and all public records or documents related to voter roll challenges that have been filed or submitted to the Fulton County Board of Registration & Elections within the last 30 days. This request specifically includes, but is not limited to, the following types of records from the following individuals:

	•	Sherri Allen (Chairperson)
	•	Aaron V. Johnson (Vice Chairperson)
	•	Michael Heekin (Board Member)
	•	Teresa K. Crawford (Board Member)
	•	Julie Adams (Board Member)
	•	Nadine Williams (Director)

The records should include:

	•	Text messages
	•	Emails (including any emails with the keywords “voter rolls,” “voter roll challenges,” “voter roll challenge,” “ineligible voters,” and “challenge” in the subject line or body of the email, as well as any other emails related to voter roll challenges that may not use these specific terms)
	•	Faxes
	•	Memos
	•	Handwritten letters

Please note that I do not seek any personal information of voters, such as names, dates of birth, or addresses. I am solely interested in the communications between the board members regarding any voter roll challenges submitted in the last 30 days. Should any of the requested documents contain such personal information, I request that you redact it in accordance with O.C.G.A. § 50-18-72(a)(20)(A), which requires the redaction of confidential information to allow for the disclosure of public records.

Please provide the requested documents in electronic format. If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me of the total cost before fulfilling my request. However, I request a waiver of all fees as this request is in the public interest.

As required by O.C.G.A. § 50-18-71(b)(1)(A), I expect a response to this request within three business days. If any records cannot be provided within this timeframe, please notify me of the reasons and specify a reasonable timeline for when the records will be available.

If you deny any part of this request, please provide a detailed explanation of the grounds for the denial, including the specific exemption you believe justifies withholding the information.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your response.

Sincerely,

Eric Scharfenberger
eric@citizenag.org

title: Request for Records Related to Detective Michael Hansbro’s Demotion and Alleged Mishandling of Digital Evidence

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: Request for Records Related to Detective Michael Hansbro’s Demotion and Alleged Mishandling of Digital Evidence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

* 1- Demotion Records:
    * Documentation or reports detailing the reasons for Detective Michael Hansbro’s demotion from detective to patrol officer.
    * Any internal memos, emails, or communications regarding the demotion.
    * 2- Disciplinary Actions:
    * Records of any disciplinary actions taken against Detective Michael Hansbro, including reprimands, suspensions, or terminations.
    * Details of any additional training provided to Detective Hansbro following disciplinary actions.
    * 4- Complaints and Investigations:
    * Records of any complaints filed against Detective Michael Hansbro, including both internal and external complaints.
    * Detailed reports from any Internal Affairs investigations involving Detective Michael Hansbro.
    * Logs or summaries of all complaints and the outcomes of any investigations.
    * 4- Performance Evaluations:
    * Copies of Detective Michael Hansbro’s performance evaluations throughout his tenure with the department.
    * 5- Training Records:
    * Records of any training completed by Detective Michael Hansbro, including any remedial training.
    * 6- Incident Reports:
    * Incident reports or case files related to Detective Michael Hansbro’s involvement in specific cases, especially those where misconduct was alleged.
    * 7- Body Camera Footage:
    * Body camera footage from incidents involving Detective Michael Hansbro, if applicable.
    * 8- Supervisor Notes:
    * Notes or reports from the supervisors of Detective Michael Hansbro.
    * 9- Psychological Evaluations:
    * Any psychological evaluations or fitness-for-duty assessments conducted on Detective Michael Hansbro.
    * 10- Early Intervention System (EIS) Records:
    * Early Intervention System (EIS) records related to Detective Michael Hansbro.
    * 11- Field Training Officer (FTO) Reports:
    * Field Training Officer (FTO) reports for Detective Michael Hansbro.
    * 12- Digital Evidence Mishandling:
    * Records of any accusations or investigations involving Detective Michael Hansbro mishandling digital evidence.
    * Documentation of any instances where Detective Michael Hansbro was unable to produce evidence that he had alleged to possess.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jay Hunt

title: Public Records Request for Training Materials Related to Cell Site Simulators

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request for Training Materials Related to Cell Site Simulators
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

related to the acquisition and use of cell-site simulators by this agency and products and services provided by Jacobs Technology, the Engineering Integration Group (EIG), and KeyW. These include, but are not limited to:
* cell-site simulators (CSS)
* the Base Station NG system
* any model of TRACHEA (2, 3, 4, 4+) or JUGULAR (2, 3, 4, 4+)
* any other services or equipment purchased from EIG or Jacobs Technology

Responsive materials include the following documents regarding the above-mentioned technologies:

Procurement and Policies: Any and all descriptions of deliverables, policies, guidance, and other documentation regarding the use of CSS systems and services and products provided by the aforementioned entities. 
Training: Any and all operation and training materials, slideshows, documentation, emails, or courses provided by EIG or Jacobs Technology related to products and services being used by this agency
Use: All records of warrants filed in relation to CSS or the above-mentioned equipment, in addition to all logs or records describing deployment of the technologies listed above.
Updates: Any and all software or firmware or updates provided by EIG or Jacobs Technologies for the Base Station NG system or TRACHEA2+ or JUGULAR 4+ system. 
Sharing and other agreements: All memoranda of understanding, nondisclosure agreements, or other agreements with other local agencies or any other party for the shared use of CSS or the sharing of information collected through its use.
This request is for all responsive materials for the period from February 1, 2024 through June 14, 2024. According to publicly available materials, the Massachusetts State Police purchased cell-site simulator equipment from Jacobs Technology earlier this year.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

title: Debt Collective - Civilian Medical Debt

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Debt Collective - Civilian Medical Debt
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) Billing and Collections data, identified by this Government Accountability Office report, from 2016 to 2021 — or if later records exist — until the last complete fiscal year with available data matching the description of this request. This data should include amounts billed and collected to civilian emergency patients of services performed within the given years. Please provide this data as a CSV file. Report Link: https://www.gao.gov/assets/gao-22-104770.pdf

2) Contracts between the Department of Treasury and the following Private Collection Agencies (PCA): 

-The CBE Group, Inc.
P.O. Box 2040
Waterloo, IA 50704-2040
- ConServe, Inc.
P.O. Box 1528
Fairport, NY 14450
- Pioneer Credit Recovery, Inc.
P.O. Box 189
Arcade, NY 14009
- Coast Professional, Inc.
P.O. Box 246
Geneseo, NY 14454
0Transworld Systems, Inc.
P.O. Box 15616
Wilmington, DE 19850

3) Contracts between the Department of Treasury and any other Private Collections Agencies (PCA) between 2016 and 2021. 

4)  PCA compliance reviews between 2016 and 2024.

5) Formal findings memo regarding PCAs compliance alongside responses by PCAs to each finding with corrective actions, if any.

6) Complaints made to PCAs or the  Cross-Servicing call center that mention or refer to medical debt between 2016 and 2023.


INSTRUCTIONS REGARDING SEARCH


1.	Instructions Regarding “Leads:” – As required by the relevant case law, Department of Treasury , show follow any leads it discovers during the conduct of its searches and performs additional searches when said leads indicate that records may be located in another system. Failure to follow clear leads is a violation of FOIA
2.	Request for Public Records – Please search for any records even if they are already publicly available. 
3.	Requests for Electronic and Paper/Manual Searches - I request that searches of all electronic and paper/manual incidences, filing systems, and locations for any and all records relating or referring to the subject of my request be conducted. 
4.	Request for Search of Filing Systems, Indices, and Locations – I request that Department of Treasury . Search all of its offices and components which are likely to contain responsive records
5.	Requests regarding photographs and other visual materials – I request that any photographs or other visual materials responsive to my request be released to me in their original or comparable forms, quality, and resolution. For example, if a photograph was taken digitally, or if Department of Treasury , maintains a photograph digitally, I request disclosure of the original digital image file, not a reduced resolution version of that image nor a printout and scan of that image file. Likewise, if a photograph was originally taken as a color photograph, I request disclosure of that photograph as a color image, not a black and white image. Please contact me for any clarification on this point. 
6.	Request for Duplicate Pages – I request disclosure of any and all supposedly “duplicate” pages. Scholars analyze records not only for the information available on any given page, but also for the relationship between that information and information on pages surrounding it. As such, though certain pages may have been previously released to me, the existence of those pages within new context renders them functionally new pages. As such, the only way to properly analyze released information is to analyze that information with its proper context. Therefore, I request disclosure of all “duplicate” pages. 
7.	Request to Search Emails – Please search for emails relating to the subject matter of my request.
8.	Request for Search of Records Transferred to Other Agencies – I request that in conducting its search, Department of Treasury , disclose releasable records even if they are available publicly through other sources outside of the organization. 
9.	Regarding Destroyed Records – If any records responsive or potentially responsive to my request have been destroyed, my request includes but is not limited to any and all records relating or referring to the destruction of those records. This includes, but is not limited to, any and all records relating or referring to the events leading to the destruction of those records. 

INSTRUCTIONS REGARDING SCOPE AND BREADTH OF REQUESTS

Please interpret the scope of this request broadly. Department of Treasury  is instructed to interpret the scope of this request in the most liberal manner possible short of any interpretation that would lend to a conclusion that the request does not reasonably describe the records sought. 

EXEMPTIONS AND SEGREBALITY

I call your attention to President Obama’s 21 January 2009 Memorandum concerning the Freedom of Information Act in which he states:

“All agencies should adopt a presumption in favor of disclosure, in order to renew their commitment to the principles embodied in FOIA…The presumption of disclosure should be applied to all decisions involving FOIA. 

In the same Memorandum, President Obama added that government information should not be kept confidential “merely because public officials might be embarrassed by disclosure, because of errors and failures might be revealed, or because of speculative or abstract fears.”

Finally, President Obama ordered that “The Freedom of Information Act should be administered with a clear presumption: In the case of doubt, openness prevails”

Nonetheless, if any responsive record or portion thereof is claimed to be exempt from production, FOIA statues provide that even if some of the requested material is properly exempt from mandatory disclosure, all segregable portions must be released. If documents are denied in part or in whole, please specify which exemption(s) is (are) claimed for each passage or whole document denied. Please provide a complete itemized inventory and a detailed factual justification of total or partial denial of documents. Specify the number of pages in each document and the toal number of pages pertaining to this request. For “classified” material denied, please include the following information: the classification (confidential., secret or top secret); identity of the classifier; date or event for automatic declassification or classification review or downgrading; if applicable, identity of official authorizing extension of automatic declassification or review past six years; and, if applicable, the reason for extended classification beyond six years.

In excising material, please “black out” the material rather than “White out” or “cut out.” I expect, as provided by FOIA, that the remaining non-exempt portions of documents will be released. Please release all pages regardless of the extent of excising, even if all that remains are stationary headings or administrative markings. 

In addition, I ask that your agency exercise its discretion to release records which may be technically exempt, but where withholdings serve no important public interest. 

ADDITIONAL INSTRUCTIONS REGARDING REQUEST

Please produce all records with administrative markings and pagination included. Please send a memo (copy to me) to the appropriate units in your office to assure that no record related to this requests are destroyed. Please advise of any destruction of records and include the data of the authority of such destruction. 

FORMAT 

I request that any release stemming from this request be provided to me in digital format (soft copy) via email, or via USB DRIVE, COMPACT DISK, or other like media. 

FEE CATEGORY AND REQUEST FOR A FEE WAIVER

I am an investigative journalist who has written for major media including Business Insider, Time, Fortune, and The Nation Magazine. I am willing to pay any reasonable expenses associated with this request, however, as the purpose of the request is disclosure in full conformity with the statutory requirements for a waiver of fees, I formally request such a waiver. I request a waiver of all costs pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii). 

Should my request for a fee waiver be denied, I request that I be categorized as a member of the news media for free purposes. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tekendra Parmar

title: FBI LDW 8.19.24

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI LDW 8.19.24
communications.communication:
Dear FOIA Officer:

You are receiving this correspondence as a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552. I am requesting the following:

Copies of all Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) records, documents, and communications responsive to Louis de Wohl, aka Ludwig von Wohl, aka Theodor Gaspar Adolf Wohl (January 24, 1903 - June 2, 1961). Mr. De Wohl was a German-born but Hungarian-raised astrologer who emigrated to Great Britain in 1935. A few years later, in 1941, Mr. De Wohl was sent to the United States by the Special Operations Executive, a British intelligence service, to convince Americans that the United States should join World War II, and while there, his tour was overseen by the British Security Coordination (BSC), a separate British intelligence service based out of New York City. The FBI and the BSC worked closely during this period, sharing intelligence on potential security threats, such as the 1939 "Joe K" spy ring out of Bermuda which was controlled by German spy Kurt Frederick Ludwig.

Mr. De Wohl's work on behalf of British intelligence was chronicled in a 2017 Daily Beast article titled "Louis de Wohl: The Astrologer Who Helped Foil Hitler": https://www.thedailybeast.com/louis-de-wohl-the-astrologer-who-helped-foil-hitler

The BSC's connection to Mr. De Wohl was documented in a separate 2006 Guardian article titled "The Secret Persuaders": https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2006/aug/19/military.secondworldwar

Proof of death is not required as Mr. De Wohl's date of birth was over 100 years ago.

I am asking you waive any fees associated with this request. I am a member of the news media. My bylines, which include Unicorn Riot, Covert Action Magazine, and the Geopolitical Economy Report, can be found in both print and electronic publications, and I am sending this request in coordination with Muckrock, an award-winning and nationally-recognized news organization. Please take note of the Office of Management and Budget guidelines published March 27, 1987 (52 FR 10012) that include electronic publications and other nontraditional publishers as representatives of the news media.

A fee waiver is appropriate in situations where "disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations and activities of the government, and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester,” 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(iii). This request would contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations and activities of government with respect to the FBI's collaborations with foreign intelligence services. Mr. De Wohl was a foreign intelligence officer operating inside the United States as part of a propaganda campaign organized by British intelligence services, one of which, the BSC, shared intelligence with the FBI in that same period. The FBI's involvement in, or knowledge of, any efforts to lobby the American public on the subject of entry into World War II prior to the attack on Pearl Harbor would contribute significantly to public understanding of America's role in that conflict.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes.

All documents will be provided to the general public without charge.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay up to $100. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I look forward to your response within 20 working days, as the statute requires. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Sincerely,

Robert Skvarla, Jr.

title: FBI: Victor J. Banis

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: Victor J. Banis
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any bureau records related to the controversial writer Victor Jerome Banis (born May 25th, 1937 - died February 22nd, 2019).  Banis was a famous and controversial writer of gay themed fiction whose death was widely reported in the media. 

In the 1960s he was was indicted by a federal grand jury in Sioux City on obscenity charges due to lesbian themes in his "The Affairs of Gloria" novel. This indictment would have likely generated FBI documentation of the novel "The Affairs of Gloria." Following his acquittal, and due in part to his anger at the government, Banis began incorporating gay themes into dozens of books that he published under different pseudonyms.

A description of his life and career can be found online here: https://www.pulpcurry.com/2019/03/farewell-to-victor-j-banis-pioneer-of-gay-pulp-popular-fiction/

Here is a list of pseudonyms he used during his writing career:
Victor Jay
J. X. Williams
Jay Vickery
Jan Alexander
Lynn Benedict
V. J. Banis


This request is for any and all records about the writer Victor J. Banis (including all pseudonyms)  from any and all FBI offices, including HQ, field offices, legal attaches, and facilities that maintain records under the FBI’s control. Please conduct a search for any records on Banis held by the Sioux City Satellite "resident agency" Office, the Martinsburg Satellite "resident agency" Office which likely maintained files on Banis. According to a blog post I just read, it is important that I state the following: "As you know, your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, but still technically under your agency’s control. For more information see 36 CFR 1250.8" Please also conduct a physical search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for any records or documents related to Victor J. Banis. 

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to Victor J. Banis.

Please include a search of any records or documents understood to be, or colloquially referred to as "COINTELPRO records" under the bureau's custody that could be construed as responsive to a request for records related to Victor J. Banis. 

If the bureau cannot fulfill certain parts of this request or if certain portions must be redacted, please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

The release of records held by the bureau would benefit the historical record. Thank you for the bureau's commitment to transparency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: OIG Report on IJ who sent fake email from EOIR Director and slept with a subordinate

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: OIG Report on IJ who sent fake email from EOIR Director and slept with a subordinate
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The complete report described in this summary: https://oig.justice.gov/reports/investigative-summary-findings-misconduct-then-acting-assistant-chief-immigration-judge

The summary describes an acting ACIJ who was accused of having had an inappropriate relationship with a subordinate. It also says that when the acting ACIJ was an IJ, he sent a fake email purporting to be from the EOIR Director to a third party. This is deeply concerning. Immigrants ordered removed by this person have a right to know if he is a biased adjudicator and if anything he did might reflect bias that would have affected their removal proceedings. Accordingly, we intend to obtain through the FOIA and publish the full report.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Hoppock
